channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: A Theoretical Framework for Explaining Reinforcement Learning with Shapley Values
item.description: In this work, we develop a theoretical framework for explaining reinforcement learning through the influence of state features, which represent what the agent observes in its environment.

item.title: Adaptive Latent-Space Constraints in Personalized FL
item.description: While the Ditto algorithm is specifically considered, such measures are directly applicable to a number of other pFL settings, and the results motivate the use of constraints tailored to the various kinds of heterogeneity expected in FL systems.

item.title: Concept-Level Explainability for Auditing & Steering LLM Responses
item.description: As large language models (LLMs) become widely deployed, concerns about their safety and alignment grow.

item.title: AIS Data-Driven Maritime Monitoring Based on Transformer: A Comprehensive Review
item.description: Therefore, this paper reviews the research on Transformer-based AIS data-driven maritime monitoring, providing a comprehensive overview of the current applications of Transformer models in the marine field.

item.title: Identifying Causal Direction via Variational Bayesian Compression
item.description: Telling apart the cause and effect between two random variables with purely observational data is a challenging problem that finds applications in various scientific disciplines.

item.title: DynamicRAG: Leveraging Outputs of Large Language Model as Feedback for Dynamic Reranking in Retrieval-Augmented Generation
item.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems combine large language models (LLMs) with external knowledge retrieval, making them highly effective for knowledge-intensive tasks.

item.title: Certified Data Removal Under High-dimensional Settings
item.description: Machine unlearning focuses on the computationally efficient removal of specific training data from trained models, ensuring that the influence of forgotten data is effectively eliminated without the need for full retraining.

item.title: LEAD: Iterative Data Selection for Efficient LLM Instruction Tuning
item.description: Instruction tuning has emerged as a critical paradigm for improving the capabilities and alignment of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: HALO: Half Life-Based Outdated Fact Filtering in Temporal Knowledge Graphs
item.description: HALO consists of three modules: the temporal fact attention module, the dynamic relation-aware encoder module, and the outdated fact filtering module.

item.title: ReCDAP: Relation-Based Conditional Diffusion with Attention Pooling for Few-Shot Knowledge Graph Completion
item.description: Knowledge Graphs (KGs), composed of triples in the form of (head, relation, tail) and consisting of entities and relations, play a key role in information retrieval systems such as question answering, entity search, and recommendation.

item.title: Multimodal Survival Modeling in the Age of Foundation Models
item.description: Prior studies have trained bespoke cancer survival prediction models from unimodal or multimodal TCGA data.

item.title: Measuring General Intelligence with Generated Games
item.description: In particular, gg-bench is synthetically generated by (1) using a large language model (LLM) to generate natural language descriptions of novel games, (2) using the LLM to implement each game in code as a Gym environment, and (3) training reinforcement learning (RL) agents via self-play on the generated games.

item.title: Chronocept: Instilling a Sense of Time in Machines
item.description: Human cognition is deeply intertwined with a sense of time, known as Chronoception.

item.title: YuLan-OneSim: Towards the Next Generation of Social Simulator with Large Language Models
item.description: To demonstrate the advantages of YuLan-OneSim, we conduct experiments to evaluate the quality of the automatically generated scenarios, the reliability, efficiency, and scalability of the simulation process, as well as the performance of the AI social researcher.

item.title: Kalman Filter Enhanced GRPO for Reinforcement Learning-Based Language Model Reasoning
item.description: Recently, for language modeling, Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) is proposed to compute the advantage for each output by subtracting the mean reward, as the baseline, for all outputs in the group.

item.title: Pre-training vs. Fine-tuning: A Reproducibility Study on Dense Retrieval Knowledge Acquisition
item.description: Recent research has questioned the role of fine-tuning vs. that of pre-training within dense retrievers, specifically arguing that retrieval knowledge is primarily gained during pre-training, meaning knowledge not acquired during pre-training cannot be sub-sequentially acquired via fine-tuning.

item.title: Unified Continuous Generative Models
item.description: We introduce a unified framework for training, sampling, and analyzing these models.

item.title: Linux Kernel Configurations at Scale: A Dataset for Performance and Evolution Analysis
item.description: Configuring the Linux kernel to meet specific requirements, such as binary size, is highly challenging due to its immense complexity-with over 15, 000 interdependent options evolving rapidly across different versions.

item.title: Cache-Efficient Posterior Sampling for Reinforcement Learning with LLM-Derived Priors Across Discrete and Continuous Domains
item.description: Integrating large language models (LLMs) as priors in reinforcement learning (RL) offers significant advantages but comes with substantial computational costs.

item.title: ALPCAH: Subspace Learning for Sample-wise Heteroscedastic Data
item.description: This paper develops a subspace learning method, named ALPCAH, that can estimate the sample-wise noise variances and use this information to improve the estimate of the subspace basis associated with the low-rank structure of the data.

item.title: Codifying Character Logic in Role-Playing
item.description: This paper introduces Codified Profiles for role-playing, a novel approach that represents character logic as structured, executable functions for behavioral decision-making.

item.title: Towards Actionable Pedagogical Feedback: A Multi-Perspective Analysis of Mathematics Teaching and Tutoring Dialogue
item.description: Effective feedback is essential for refining instructional practices in mathematics education, and researchers often turn to advanced natural language processing (NLP) models to analyze classroom dialogues from multiple perspectives.

item.title: FCPCA: Fuzzy clustering of high-dimensional time series based on common principal component analysis
item.description: Clustering multivariate time series data is a crucial task in many domains, as it enables the identification of meaningful patterns and groups in time-evolving data.

item.title: ABS-Mamba: SAM2-Driven Bidirectional Spiral Mamba Network for Medical Image Translation
item.description: Accurate multi-modal medical image translation requires ha-rmonizing global anatomical semantics and local structural fidelity, a challenge complicated by intermodality information loss and structural distortion.

item.title: Anatomical Attention Alignment representation for Radiology Report Generation
item.description: Automated Radiology report generation (RRG) aims at producing detailed descriptions of medical images, reducing radiologists' workload and improving access to high-quality diagnostic services.

item.title: Continuous Visual Autoregressive Generation via Score Maximization
item.description: When applied to continuous modalities such as visual data, Visual AutoRegressive modeling (VAR) typically resorts to quantization-based approaches to cast the data into a discrete space, which can introduce significant information loss.

item.title: Web-Bench: A LLM Code Benchmark Based on Web Standards and Frameworks
item.description: Among various attempts to address benchmark saturation, approaches based on software engineering have stood out, but the saturation of existing software engineering benchmarks is rapidly increasing.

item.title: Skull stripping with purely synthetic data
item.description: While many skull stripping algorithms have been developed for multi-modal and multi-species cases, there is still a lack of a fundamentally generalizable approach.

item.title: Language-Driven Dual Style Mixing for Single-Domain Generalized Object Detection
item.description: Then, we propose image-level style mixing between the diversified images and source domain images.

item.title: Metrics that matter: Evaluating image quality metrics for medical image generation
item.description: Evaluating generative models for synthetic medical imaging is crucial yet challenging, especially given the high standards of fidelity, anatomical accuracy, and safety required for clinical applications.

item.title: From raw affiliations to organization identifiers
item.description: Accurate affiliation matching, which links affiliation strings to standardized organization identifiers, is critical for improving research metadata quality, facilitating comprehensive bibliometric analyses, and supporting data interoperability across scholarly knowledge bases.

item.title: Agent RL Scaling Law: Agent RL with Spontaneous Code Execution for Mathematical Problem Solving
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) often struggle with mathematical reasoning tasks requiring precise, verifiable computation.

item.title: Boosting Global-Local Feature Matching via Anomaly Synthesis for Multi-Class Point Cloud Anomaly Detection
item.description: Specifically, GLFM is structured into three stages: Stage-I proposes an anomaly synthesis pipeline that stretches point clouds to create abundant anomaly data that are utilized to adapt the point cloud feature extractor for better feature representation.

item.title: Ophora: A Large-Scale Data-Driven Text-Guided Ophthalmic Surgical Video Generation Model
item.description: In ophthalmic surgery, developing an AI system capable of interpreting surgical videos and predicting subsequent operations requires numerous ophthalmic surgical videos with high-quality annotations, which are difficult to collect due to privacy concerns and labor consumption.

item.title: MiMo: Unlocking the Reasoning Potential of Language Model -- From Pretraining to Posttraining
item.description: We present MiMo-7B, a large language model born for reasoning tasks, with optimization across both pre-training and post-training stages.

item.title: From Search To Sampling: Generative Models For Robust Algorithmic Recourse
item.description: We show that existing methods train for these objectives separately and then search for recourse through a joint optimization over the recourse goals during inference, leading to poor recourse recommendations.

item.title: You Only Look One Step: Accelerating Backpropagation in Diffusion Sampling with Gradient Shortcuts
item.description: However, many downstream tasks require guiding the generated content based on specific differentiable metrics, typically necessitating backpropagation during the generation process.

item.title: Unsupervised Learning for Class Distribution Mismatch
item.description: Specifically, with a 60% mismatch proportion on Tiny-ImageNet dataset, our approach, without relying on labeled data, surpasses OpenMatch (with 40 labels per class) by 35. 1%, 63. 7%, and 72. 5% in classifying known, unknown, and new classes.

item.title: Whitened CLIP as a Likelihood Surrogate of Images and Captions
item.description: We examine the use of Contrastive Language-Image Pre-training (CLIP) to assess the likelihood of images and captions.

item.title: Transformer-Based Dual-Optical Attention Fusion Crowd Head Point Counting and Localization Network
item.description: In this paper, the dual-optical attention fusion crowd head point counting model (TAPNet) is proposed to address the problem of the difficulty of accurate counting in complex scenes such as crowd dense occlusion and low light in crowd counting tasks under UAV view.

item.title: Predicting Surgical Safety Margins in Osteosarcoma Knee Resections: An Unsupervised Approach
item.description: According to the Pan American Health Organization, the number of cancer cases in Latin America was estimated at 4. 2 million in 2022 and is projected to rise to 6. 7 million by 2045.

item.title: Multimodal Fake News Detection: MFND Dataset and Shallow-Deep Multitask Learning
item.description: Furthermore, we propose a Shallow-Deep Multitask Learning (SDML) model for fake news, which fully uses unimodal and mutual modal features to mine the intrinsic semantics of news.

item.title: High-Frequency Prior-Driven Adaptive Masking for Accelerating Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The primary challenge in accelerating image super-resolution lies in reducing computation while maintaining performance and adaptability.

item.title: MELLM: Exploring LLM-Powered Micro-Expression Understanding Enhanced by Subtle Motion Perception
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel Micro-Expression Large Language Model (MELLM), which incorporates a subtle facial motion perception strategy with the strong inference capabilities of MLLMs, representing the first exploration of MLLMs in the domain of ME analysis.

item.title: Semantic-Guided Diffusion Model for Single-Step Image Super-Resolution
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose SAMSR, a semantic-guided diffusion framework that incorporates semantic segmentation masks into the sampling process.

item.title: A Split-then-Join Approach to Abstractive Summarization for Very Long Documents in a Low Resource Setting
item.description: We'll use the pretrained $\texttt{BIGBIRD-PEGASUS}$ model by fine tuned the model on other domain dataset.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning (RL) Meets Urban Climate Modeling: Investigating the Efficacy and Impacts of RL-Based HVAC Control
item.description: This study proposes an integrated framework combining RL with an urban climate model that incorporates a building energy model, aiming to evaluate the efficacy of RL-based HVAC control across different background climates, impacts of RL strategies on indoor climate and local urban climate, and the transferability of RL strategies across cities.

item.title: The power of fine-grained experts: Granularity boosts expressivity in Mixture of Experts
item.description: Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) layers are increasingly central to frontier model architectures.

item.title: Web Page Classification using LLMs for Crawling Support
item.description: A web crawler is a system designed to collect web pages, and efficient crawling of new pages requires appropriate algorithms.

item.title: From Knowledge to Reasoning: Evaluating LLMs for Ionic Liquids Research in Chemical and Biological Engineering
item.description: Although Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable performance in diverse general knowledge and reasoning tasks, their utility in the scientific domain of Chemical and Biological Engineering (CBE) is unclear.
